intro: Acmella radicans, commonly known as the creeping shotgunplant, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its fleshy, succulent stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is native to tropical regions of South America and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Acmella radicans is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to form dense ground covers.
